verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
yatir yayātiḥ saṁyātir
āyatir viyatiḥ kṛtiḥ
ṣaḍ ime nahuṣasyāsann
indriyāṇīva dehinaḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; yatiḥ—Yati; yayātiḥ—Yayāti; saṁyātiḥ—Saṁyāti; āyatiḥ—Āyati; viyatiḥ—Viyati; kṛtiḥ—Kṛti; ṣaṭ—six; ime—all of them; nahuṣasya—of King Nahuṣa; āsan—were; indriyāṇi—the (six) senses; iva—like; dehinaḥ—of an embodied soul.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: O King Parīkṣit, as the embodied soul has six senses, King Nahuṣa had six sons, named Yati, Yayāti, Saṁyāti, Āyati, Viyati and Kṛti.
